refnamediv.refpurpose: Return a description of a context's error condition

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: lod_errmsg returns a pointer to either static buffer, or a buffer allocated by the context, and which contains a description of the error condition associated with the context.

Note that lod_errmsg will always return a valid string pointer, even if no error has actually occurred. In circumstances where the return value of a previous call does not unambigiously indicate that an error did occur, use lod_error to determine whether an error condition is associated with the context before calling lod_errmsg.

refsect1.title: Warning
refsect1.para: The pointer returned by lod_errmsg becomes invalid as soon as any other call involving the context (including any instance derived from it) is made.

refsect1.title: Return value
refsect1.para: A pointer to a constant string describing the error condition associated with the context.
